meanings.definition: A particularly bad or unpleasant part of an event or situation.
meanings.sent1: The rainy day was full of lowlights, like forgetting my umbrella and stepping in a puddle.
meanings.sent2: The movie had some lowlights, such as the main character's sudden betrayal.
meanings.sent3: The lowlights of the party were when the cake fell on the floor and the dog ate it.
meanings.sent4: The lowlights of the journey were the missed flights and lost luggage.
meanings.sent5: The lowlights of the play were the actors forgetting their lines and the set falling apart.

meanings.definition: Strands of hair that are dyed a darker color than the rest of the hair to create contrast.
meanings.sent1: She decided to add some lowlights to her blonde hair for a new look.
meanings.sent2: The stylist recommended adding lowlights to create dimension in her hair.
meanings.sent3: Her lowlights made her hair look like a beautiful sunset.
meanings.sent4: The lowlights in her hair added depth and richness to her overall look.
meanings.sent5: The lowlights blended seamlessly with her natural hair color, enhancing her features.
